subject: Real Estate
title: Variances: Bending the Rules
description: A micro-lesson that makes Variances: Bending the Rules usable.

hook.text: Your lot is oddly shaped and too narrow for the required setback. The rules don't fit â€” so you ask for an exception.

buildup.text: A variance is an official exception to zoning rules, granted when strict compliance creates unnecessary hardship.

discovery.text: Applicants must prove the hardship is unique to their property, not self-created, and won't harm neighbors.

twist.text: Wealthy developers often obtain variances that small homeowners can't afford to apply for.

climax.text: Variances make zoning flexible â€” but the flexibility isn't always equally accessible.

punchline.text: Zoning has exceptions â€” for those who can afford to ask.

quiz.question: When is a zoning variance typically granted?
options: When strict compliance causes unique hardship
